Description: Papyrus written with black ink, demotic legal document dated to month of Pharmuthi of year 5 of Ptolemy Philopator. 10 lines on recto, names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale and receipt of portion of a house, and confirmation of previous sale of share in certain tomb liturgies by Ta-nofer daughter of Amenhotep to Tsenatum. Scribe: Petiese son of Pa-he (Paes)." Concerning Tanefer, cf. P BM EA 10074.
Curator's comments: Thompson MS: "Publ. Revillout, rev.eg. IV.153. Reich. Papyri...aus dem Brit.mus.Denkschr.d.ak.d.wiss.in wien. 1914. p.bo & pl. XIV, XV, XVIII" Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Reich 1914 / Papyri juistischen Inhalts in hieratischer und demotischer Schrift aus dem British Museum (p.60-68, pl.14-5, 18)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2721) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2721)
